    ### FMCW - Terms and Definitions 

        - Carrier Frequency
        - Bandwidth of signal   The difference betwwen highest frequency and the lowest frequency of the signal
        - What is chirp : One freqeuncy sweep from lowest to highest frequency
        - Chirp Time : Total Propagation time of the modulated signal of one chirp
        - Slope of the chirp : Bandwidth / Chirp Time
        - Segment : One Segment or One Chirp Sequence or one Frame 
        - Time of Segment
        - Intermediate Frequency : Difference between the trasnmitted signal frequency and received signal frequency 
        - Chirp Samplig Rate :  The Rx chirp signal is sampled by ADC to convert analog signal to digital. The frequency at which sampling of one chirp takes place is called as sampling Rate. 


    
    ### FMCW - Range Measurement 

        - Tx and Rx frequency are procesed in the mixer and Intermediate frequency
        - This IF is used to calculate the distance of the target object from the radar sensor mounted on vehicle
        - The maximum range of sensor : maximum distance to which radar can detect objects

    ### FMCW - Doppler Velocity Measurement 

        -  Object moving away - rx signal low frequency 
        -  Object moving towards - rx signal high frequency
        -  Hence , the IF has some component of freqeuncy
        -  The phase change of the reflected signal in two consecutive chirps is measured
        -  *** Stp1 Calculate phase change in two consecutive chirps of frame
        -  *** Stp2 Calculate Frequency
        -  *** Stp3 Calculate Relative Velocity 
        -  *** Number of chirps in one frame of radar signal plays major role in velocity Measurement 
        -  **** Maximum velocity measurement by Radar
        -  **** FMCW better velocity resolution 

    ### Angle of Arrival 

        -  Angle is calculated by measuring the phase difference of the same Rx signal , 
        -  Both antenna are placed at distance d on the analog PCB of the sensor,
        -  Higher the Rx antenna count -->>> small the angular resolution value -->> better angular resolution 
        -  Available solution , multi input multi output radar is ised to increase the total Rx , 
        -  MIMO technology is used almost in every automotive RADAR today
